article.description: Butler, behind 26 points from Darnell Archey, upsets Louisville to advance to Albany.

article.linkText: Butler takes Louisville seat at Sweet 16 party
article.story: LOUISVILLE, Ky. (AP) -- Taquan Dean and Francisco Garcia scored 17 points apiece to lead No. 17 Louisville to a 73-59 win over the Asheville Altitude in an exhibition game Sunday. Larry O'Bannon was the only other Cardinal in double figures, scoring 10 points. Desmond Penigar, a former player at Utah State, scored 18 to lead Asheville, a team from the National Basketball Developmental League. The Cardinals went on a 20-6 run to open a 25-10 lead with 10:19 left in the first half. Freshman Brandon Jenkins sank two 3-pointers to end the spurt. The lead reached 25, at 38-13, before the Altitude went on a 15-0 run bridging the first and second halves. Louisville mounted a 13-3 run to lead 51-30 with 13:31 left. Asheville, coached by former DePaul coach Joey Meyer, got no closer than 10 the rest of the game.
